thread.title: ICRC says 10 aid workers freed after going missing in South Sudan

title: ICRC says 10 aid workers freed after going missing in South Sudan

organizations.name: international committee of the red cross

text:
April 30, 2018 / 1:28 PM / Updated 26 minutes ago ICRC says 10 aid workers freed after going missing in South Sudan Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
GENEVA (Reuters) - Ten aid workers who went missing in South Sudan last week have been freed from an armed group that detained them in the Yei region southwest of the capital, the International Committee of the Red Cross said in a statement on Monday.
The ICRC said none of those detained were ICRC staff officials and it was not involved in negotiations for their release, but they were flown in an ICRC aircraft to the capital Juba on Monday. Reporting by Tom Miles; Editing by Alison Williams
